DataElement.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Diagnostic Imaging Positive Finding Lymphoma Involvement Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the positron emission tomography (PET) scan was positive for lymphoma involvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Diagnostic Imaging Positive Finding Lymphoma Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered._Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation._An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism._A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites.  This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredDefinition: An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites.  This category includes Non-Hodgkin's lymphomas and Hodgkin's lymphomas. -- 2003:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
